trustfund:
TF033224-COMMONWEALTH OF INDEPENDENT
            STATES -POLICY NOTES 1 (AZERBAIJAN - SAL, T,TF033139-AZERBAIJAN - STRUCTURAL
            ADJUSTMENT CREDIT

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory, and
            sustainability is likely, however, institutional development
            impacts are modest. Lessons learned suggest that: 1)
            transition to a market economy is a gradual, and lengthy
            process, that is marked by successive incremental changes to
            the status quo. From this perspective, the project's
            agenda may have been overly ambitious, setting to accomplish
            extensive changes in a very short period of time. Yet,
            without such an ambitious program, the project most likely
            would not have achieved as much as it did; 2) unanticipated
            circumstances required timetable adjustments, thus, the
            Bank's flexibility to adapt to changing circumstances,
            contributed to a greater Government commitment, and the
            project success; and, 3) the sustainability of the fragile
            reform program is questionable, for although policy actions
            were adequately implemented, the perceived weakness in
            Government ownership of the development process, needs
            further attention to ensure shared objectives are met.
